SEARCH
Package librarySE.managers

Class BorrowRecord

java.lang.Object
librarySE.managers.BorrowRecord
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BorrowRecord extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a single borrowing transaction between a User and a LibraryItem.

Each BorrowRecord tracks key details such as:

  • The user who borrowed the item
  • The borrowed item and its associated fine strategy
  • The borrow date, due date, and current status
  • Any overdue fines and payments applied

Key Responsibilities:

  • Calculates fines dynamically based on overdue days using FineStrategy.
  • Applies fines to users and supports partial fine payments.
  • Tracks borrow state transitions (BORROWED → RETURNED).
  • Supports overdue checks and fine recalculations at any date.

Design Notes:

The class implements Serializable to support persistent storage in JSON or binary format for future auditing and reporting.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • BorrowRecord

      public BorrowRecord(User user, LibraryItem item, FineStrategy fineStrategy, LocalDate borrowDate)
      Creates a new borrow record linking a User, LibraryItem, and FineStrategy.

      The due date is automatically computed based on the borrow date and the strategy’s allowed period.

      Parameters:
      user - the borrowing user (must not be null)
      item - the borrowed item (must not be null)
      fineStrategy - the fine strategy to apply (must not be null)
      borrowDate - the borrow date (must not be null)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null

  • Method Details

    • ensureFineStrategy

      public void ensureFineStrategy()
      Ensures that fineStrategy is initialized.

      When records are loaded from JSON, the strategy field is not deserialized (it is transient). This method reconstructs it from the item's material type if needed.

    • setFinePaid

      public void setFinePaid(BigDecimal amount)
      Updates the paid fine amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount paid (non-null, non-negative, ≤ total fine)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if invalid payment amount

    • calculateFine

      public void calculateFine(LocalDate currentDate)
      Calculates the overdue fine dynamically for a given date.

      If the item is overdue (not returned and date is past due date), the fine is computed using the assigned FineStrategy.

      Parameters:
      currentDate - the date for which to calculate the fine
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if currentDate is null

    • applyFineToUser

      public void applyFineToUser(LocalDate currentDate)
      Applies the calculated fine to the user’s account balance (if not already applied).
      Parameters:
      currentDate - the date of fine application

    • markReturned

      public void markReturned(LocalDate returnDate)
      Marks the borrowed item as returned and updates user fines accordingly.
      Parameters:
      returnDate - the date the item was returned

    • isOverdue

      public boolean isOverdue(LocalDate currentDate)
      Checks whether the borrowed item is overdue based on a given date.
      Parameters:
      currentDate - the date to check
      Returns:
      true if the item is overdue and not yet returned
